YELLOW FEVER CONTROL
THEODORE C. LYSTER, M.D.
DIRECTOR FOR
MEXICO AND CENTRAL AMERICA
May 13, 1921.
H. R. Carter, M. D.,
2121 California Street, N.W.,
Washington, D. C.
Dear Dr. Carter:-
div1.p:
Many thanks for your letter of April 20th.
It is great to know that you are back again the States, and
I hope now you will keep in good condition. Your account
of conditions in Peru is most interesting, and I do hope that
Dr. Hanson will be able to keep going until final elimination.
He, no doubt, will take the matter up directly with Dr. Rose,
should he need additional funds. Have just had word trans-
mitted through the Foundation from Vaughn that Honduras has not
had Yellow Fever this year. He is now investigating further
to make absolutely certain. If this is true, which, I both
think and hope, we can now feel pretty sure that there is no
Yellow Fever north of Panama. Strange to say the work done
in Merida last year, together with probably other causes, has
eliminated it from what we expected to prove a most difficult
strong-hold. Connor writes that as far ashe can find there is
no Yellow Fever in Yucatan. The last case was in December
in one of the small towns near Merida, but none in Merida proper
since last Spring. We have had a flurry in Veracruz extending
H. R. Carter, M. D. 2
north to Tampico, but our last case in Veracruz was about the
middle of March, and since then we have been free a both in
Veracruz proper and the area previously infected. We have
just investigated two reported deaths in Papantla, and feel sure
that they were not Yellow Fever.

However, intensive work is going on, and we have no idea of
letting up for another year. I will keep you advised from time
to time. Let me know what you think of our article “Yellow
Fever: Its Distribution and Control in 1920”.

Dr. Noguchi has asked me to prepare an article on the use
of Yellow Fever vaccine and serum, which I am now gathering in some
shape.

Best regards to Miss Laura, and hoping you will occasionally
take time to write me your opinion of Yellow Fever conditions,
